articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ireland, Spain and Norway announced on Wednesday that they would recognise a Palestinian state on May 28 and hoped other Western countries would follow suit, prompting an angry response from Israel which recalled its ambassadors from the three capitals.
articles.title: Three European nations to recognize Palestinian state on May 28

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli tanks advanced to the edge of a crowded district in the heart of Rafah on Wednesday during one of the most intense nights of bombardment of the southern Gaza city since Israel launched its offensive there this month.
articles.title: Israeli forces move deeper into Rafah in night of heavy battle

articles.author: Dan Williams
articles.description: Israeli television aired previously withheld footage on Wednesday of five pyjama-clad female army conscripts being seized by Hamas gunmen during the Oct. 7 raid that triggered the Gaza war.
articles.title: Israel releases film of female conscripts held by Hamas

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Biden administration remains concerned about Israel's possible use of heavy bombs against civilians in the southern Gaza city of Rafah and is in contact with Israel about it, U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken said on Wednesday.
articles.title: US has ongoing conversation with Israel over weapons use, Blinken says

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Iran's Supreme Leader led prayers in Tehran on Wednesday at the funeral of the late President Ebrahim Raisi, as the clerical establishment hurried to organise an early election that could further erode its legitimacy amid growing public discontent.
articles.title: Iran Supreme Leader leads prayers at Raisi funeral as election looms

articles.author: Elizabeth Piper, Andrew Macaskill, William James
articles.description: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak called a national election for July 4 on Wednesday, saying Britons would be able to choose their future in a vote his Conservatives are widely expected to lose to the opposition Labour Party after 14 years in power.
articles.title: Rishi Sunak calls UK national election for July 4

articles.author: Kokkai Ng, Joseph Campbell
articles.description: More than 140 passengers and crew from a Singapore Airlines flight hit by heavy turbulence that left dozens injured and one dead finally reached Singapore on a relief flight Wednesday morning after an emergency landing in Bangkok.
articles.title: Shaken passengers arrive in Singapore after deadly turbulence-stricken flight

articles.author: Nellie Peyton
articles.description: South Africa's small Muslim political party Al Jama-ah is gaining support due to the conflict in Gaza and sees itself as a potential coalition partner for the African National Congress after next week's vote, its leader said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Boosted by Gaza war, South African Muslim party open to deal with ANC

articles.author: Kirsty Needham
articles.description: Protesters and a thousand French police reinforcements were playing a "game of cat and mouse" in New Caledonia, an independence group said on Wednesday, ahead of the arrival of France's President Emmanuel Macron after the worst riots in 40 years.
articles.title: New Caledonia protesters, police spar ahead of Macron visit

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: One Iraqi soldier was killed and two were wounded after an explosive device detonated on their vehicle in an area between the Diyala and Salahuddin governorates in eastern Iraq on Wednesday, two security sources said.
articles.title: Islamic State claims attack on vehicle in Iraq which killed soldier
